It is well understood that the use of personally identifiable information should follow privacy policies and practices that are generally recognized as meeting or exceeding industry or governmental requirements for maintaining the privacy of users. In particular, personally identifiable information data should be managed and handled so as to minimize risks of unintentional or unauthorized access or use, and the nature of authorized use should be clearly indicated to users.

claim.claim-text: 1. A method, comprising:receiving, via processing circuitry of user equipment, a first indication to transmit a message associated with an emergency-related request on a network;generating, via the processing circuitry, a connection request comprising a second indication of a number of receive branches of the user equipment based on the first indication, wherein a receiver of the user equipment uses one or more receive branches when communicating on the network; andtransmitting, via a transmitter of user equipment, the connection request to a network communication node associated with the network.

2. The method of claim 1, comprising:generating, via the processing circuitry, a setup request comprising a third indication indicating that the connection request is associated with the emergency-related request; andtransmitting, via the transmitter, the setup request to the network communication node.

3. The method of claim 2, comprising:receiving, via the receiver, a contention resolution response from the network communication node, the network communication node generating the contention resolution based on determining to fulfill the connection request, the second indication, and the third indication; andcommunicating, via the transmitter or the receiver, with the network communication node based on the contention resolution response.

4. The method of claim 2, comprising:receiving, via the processing circuitry, an indication that the network communication node ended a connection; andtransmitting, via the processing circuitry, the message on the network via an additional network communication node based on the network communication node ending the connection.

5. The method of claim 2, wherein the second indication comprises an indication of an emergency establishment cause, a mps-PriorityAccess establishment cause, a mcs-PriorityAccess establishment cause, or any combination thereof.

6. The method of claim 1, comprising:determining, via the processing circuitry, that the network communication node ended a connection before transmitting a setup request to the network communication node.

7. The method of claim 1, wherein generating, via the processing circuitry, the connection request comprises generating, via the processing circuitry, the connection request to include the first indication indicating one receive branch.

8. The method of claim 1, wherein generating, via the processing circuitry, the connection request comprises generating, via the processing circuitry, the connection request to be sent on a connection with the network communication node using a frequency between 0.41 gigahertz (GHz) and 7.125 GHz.

9. The method of claim 1, comprising receiving, via the receiver, a third indication that the network communication node has handed over the connection request to an additional network communication mode before receiving, via the receiver, a contention resolution response from the network communication node.

10. A network communication node, comprising:a transceiver; andprocessing circuitry configured toreceive, via the transceiver, a connection request from user equipment, the connection request corresponding to a first indication of an only one receive branch,determine to accept the connection request based on an indication that communication with the only one receive branch is supported by the transceiver,generate a contention resolution response to establish a connection with the user equipment based on accepting the connection request, andtransmit, via the transceiver, the contention resolution response to the user equipment.

11. The network communication node of claim 10, wherein the transceiver is configured to transmit the contention resolution response to the user equipment using a connection on a frequency between 0.41 gigahertz (GHz) to 7.125 GHz.

12. The network communication node of claim 10, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to receive, via the transceiver, the connection request from user equipment at least in part by receiving, via the transceiver, a random access preamble from the user equipment, the random access preamble comprising the first indication.

13. The network communication node of claim 10, wherein the processing circuitry is configured toin response to receiving, via the transceiver, the connection request,determining that a reduced number of receive branches was indicated via the first indication by the user equipment, andtransmitting an uplink scheduling information packet to the user equipment in response to the determination.

14. The network communication node of claim 10, wherein the processing circuitry is configured todetermine to handover user equipment to an additional network communication node after ongoing communications with the user equipment,request a system information block (SIB) from the additional network communication node,determine that the additional network communication node supports requests related to emergency-service access, andhandover the user equipment to the additional network communication node.

15. A network communication node, comprising:a transceiver; andprocessing circuitry configured toreceive, via the transceiver, a random access preamble from user equipment corresponding to a connection request, the random access preamble comprising a first indication of a number of receive branches associated with the user equipment,determine that the number of receive branches corresponds to a reduced number of receive branches,transmit, via the transceiver, uplink scheduling information to the user equipment based on the determination.

16. The network communication node of claim 15, wherein the processing circuitry is configured toreceive, via the transceiver, a second indication from the user equipment indicating that the connection request is associated with an emergency based on the uplink scheduling information,determine to fulfill the connection request based on the second indication; andtransmit, via the transceiver, a contention resolution response to the user equipment based on determining to fulfill the connection request.

17. The network communication node of claim 15, comprising a memory configured to store a third indication of a preferred frequency range of the transceiver, the preferred frequency range of the transceiver corresponding to a frequency range assigned by a network provider to the transceiver.

18. The network communication node of claim 17, wherein the processing circuitry is configured toafter determining that the number of receive branches corresponds to the reduced number of receive branches, determining not to end a connection with the user equipment based on the third indication; andgenerating the uplink scheduling information based on determining to not end the connection with the user equipment and the preferred frequency range of the transceiver.

19. The network communication node of claim 18, wherein the processing circuitry is configured toreceive, via the transceiver, a subsequent connection request from another user equipment to establish communication,determine that the subsequent connection request does not correspond to an urgent service fulfillment based on receiving the subsequent connection request, andredirect the subsequent connection request to use the preferred frequency range used by the transceiver.

20. The network communication node of claim 19, wherein the urgent service fulfillment comprises an indication of an emergency establishment cause, a multimedia priority service establishment cause, a mission critical service establishment cause, or any combination thereof.
